title: Awesome Docker
description: A curated list of Docker resources and projects

items.title: Benefits of using Docker
items.desc: for development and delivery, with a practical roadmap for adoption.

items.title: Bootstrapping Microservices
items.desc: by Ashley Davis - A practical and project-based guide to building applications with microservices, starts by building a Docker image for a single microservice and publishing it to a private container registry, finishes by deploying a complete microservices application to a production Kubernetes cluster.

items.title: Docker Curriculum
items.desc: A comprehensive tutorial for getting started with Docker. Teaches how to use Docker and deploy dockerized apps on AWS with Elastic Beanstalk and Elastic Container Service.

items.title: Docker Documentation
items.desc: the official documentation.

items.title: Docker for beginners
items.desc: A tutorial for beginners who need to learn the basics of Dockerâ€”from "Hello world!" to basic interactions with containers, with simple explanations of the underlying concepts.

items.title: Docker for novices
items.desc: An introduction to Docker for developers and testers who have never used it. (Video 1h40, recorded linux.conf.au 2019 â€” Christchurch, New Zealand) by Alex Clews.

items.title: Docker katas
items.desc: A series of labs that will take you from "Hello Docker" to deploying a containerized web application to a server.

items.title: Docker Latest Tutorial
items.desc: â€” This is a series of latest docker tutorial, where you can learn what is docker, docker lifecycle, how to run Nginx Web Server in Docker?, how to run mysql on docker container, how to use Python on doceker and many other important topics.

items.title: Docker simplified in 55 seconds
items.desc: An animated high-level introduction to Docker. Think of it as a visual tl;dr that makes it easier to dive into more complex learning materials.

items.title: Docker Training
items.desc: ðŸ’²

items.title: Docker Tutorial for Beginners (Updated 2019 version)
items.desc: â€”Â In this Docker tutorial, you'll learn all the basics and learn how you can containerize Node.js and Go applications. Even if you aren't familiar with these languages it should be easy for you to follow this tutorial and use any other language.

items.title: Learn Docker
items.desc: step-by-step tutorial and more resources (video, articles, cheat sheets) by @dwyl

items.title: Learn Docker (Visually)
items.desc: A beginner-focused high-level overview of all the major components of Docker and how they fit together. Lots of high-quality images, examples, and resources.

items.title: Play With Docker
items.desc: PWD is a great way to get started with Docker from beginner to advanced users. Docker runs directly in your browser.

items.title: Practical Guide about Docker Commands in Spanish
items.desc: This spanish guide contains the use of basic docker commands with real life examples.

items.title: Practical Introduction to Container Terminology
items.desc: The landscape for container technologies is larger than just docker. Without a good handle on the terminology, It can be difficult to grasp the key differences between docker and (pick your favorites, CRI-O, rkt, lxc/lxd) or understand what the Open Container Initiative is doing to standardize container technology.

items.title: Setting Python Development Environment with VScode and Docker
items.desc: A step-by-step tutorial for setting up a dockerized Python development environment with VScode, Docker, and the Dev Container extension.

items.title: The Docker Handbook
items.desc: An open-source book that teaches you the fundamentals, best practices and some intermediate Docker functionalities. The book is hosted on fhsinchy/the-docker-handbook and the projects are hosted on fhsinchy/docker-handbook-projects repository.

items.title: A Comparative Study of Docker Engine on Windows Server vs Linux Platform
items.desc: Comparing the feature sets and implementations of Docker on Windows and Linux

items.title: Docker on Windows behind a firewall
items.desc: by @kaitoedter

items.title: Docker Reference Architecture: Modernizing Traditional .NET Framework Applications
items.desc: You will learn to identify the types of .NET Framework applications that are good candidates for containerization, the "lift-and-shift" approach to containerization.

items.title: Docker with Microsoft SQL 2016 + ASP.NET
items.desc: Demonstration running ASP.NET and SQL Server workloads in Docker

items.title: Exploring ASP.NET Core with Docker in both Linux and Windows Containers
items.desc: Running ASP.NET Core apps in Linux and Windows containers, using Docker for Windows

items.title: Running a Legacy ASP.NET App in a Windows Container
items.desc: Steps for Dockerizing a legacy ASP.NET app and running as a Windows container

items.title: Windows Containers and Docker: The 101
items.desc: ðŸŽ¥ - A 20-minute overview, using Docker to run PowerShell, ASP.NET Core and ASP.NET apps

items.desc: Overview of Windows containers, drilling down to Quick Starts for Windows 10 and Windows Server 2016
